meanings.definition: Capable of being conferred or granted.
meanings.sent1: The award was conferrable upon the top student in the class.
meanings.sent2: The scholarship is conferrable to students with exceptional academic performance.
meanings.sent3: It was a conferrable honor to be chosen as the team captain.
meanings.sent4: The title of 'Employee of the Month' is a conferrable recognition.
meanings.sent5: The prestigious award is only conferrable to those who demonstrate outstanding leadership skills.

meanings.definition: Able to be transferred or passed on to someone else.
meanings.sent1: The property is conferrable to the next of kin in the will.
meanings.sent2: The rights to the invention are conferrable to the company upon signing the contract.
meanings.sent3: The conferrable responsibility of leading the project was given to the most experienced team member.
meanings.sent4: Her contagious positivity was conferrable to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The magic wand's powers were only conferrable to the rightful owner.
